message.content:
cs.GT, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.MA, cs.EC 

This paper deals with the problem of dynamic pricing, which is a classic topic in the field of algorithmic game theory (cs.GT) and computational economics (cs.EC). The use of prior-independent mechanisms and the comparison to an offline benchmark suggest a focus on learning theory (cs.LG) and online algorithms (cs.DS). The connection to multi-armed bandits (MAB) is also mentioned, which is a well-studied problem in machine learning (cs.MA).
